page.title: 16ECOLOGY 2
page.content: Both hedge and tree nesting birds find suitable cover, and the bird population is swelled by migrant visitors both winter and summer. The richness of the food chain can be indicated by the number of birds of prey - mainly buzzards and owls which are supported by the area. A dash of exotica is also added by the large number of escapee pheasants throughout the year. Butterflies and moths also find the climate suitable to both winter hibernation and summer migration, and hundreds of insects nd bugs exist in large numbers. The wild flowers include most types which grow in pasture,woodland,meadow- land and hedgebank situations. Trees include oak,beech,sycamore,ash,willow, horse-chestnut,hazel and holly, also more recently- coniferous plantations.
